page.title: 07PRECIOUS METAL RECOVERY
page.content: Of the new industries in the Tame Valley, one of the most interesting of them demonstrates the rapidly changing nature of industry due to rapid advances in technology. N.E.C.P.(Reclamation) Ltd buys scrap computers from all over the Continent to extract the precious metals from them. The computer parts are broken into small pieces then pulverised. Ferrous metal are removed by magnets and the plastics by flotation. Gold, silver and platignum are separated using chemicals and ingots, worth at present prices Â£15,000, are the end product. Quite a change from the factory's previous role as a 'Pickle Works' producing many kinds of preserved foods.
